articles.author: ERIC TUCKER, ALANNA DURKIN RICHER and TERRY SPENCER
articles.description: FORT PIERCE, Fla. (AP) — Donald Trump arrived Thursday at a federal courthouse in Florida, where a judge is hearing arguments on whether to dismiss the criminal case accusing the former president of hoarding and hiding classified documents at his Mar-a-Lago estate after he left the White House.
articles.title: Trump arrives at Florida courthouse for hearing on whether to dismiss his classified documents case

articles.author: TIA GOLDENBERG
articles.description: TEL AVIV, Israel (AP) — The Israeli military said Wednesday it plans to direct a significant portion of the 1.4 million displaced Palestinians living in the Gaza Strip’s southernmost town of Rafah toward “humanitarian islands” in the center of the territory ahead of its planned offensive in the area.
articles.title: Israel says it plans to direct Palestinians out of Rafah ahead of anticipated offensive

articles.author: MARY CLARE JALONICK and ELLEN KNICKMEYER
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer on Thursday called on Israel to hold new elections, saying he believes Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has “lost his way” and is an obstacle to peace in the region amid a growing humanitarian crisis in Gaza.
articles.title: Top Democrat Schumer calls for new elections in Israel, saying Netanyahu is an obstacle to peace

articles.author: EMMA BURROWS
articles.description: Ukraine fired at least eight missiles at Russia’s Belgorod border region, killing two people and wounding 12, local officials said Thursday, as Kyiv’s forces apparently kept up efforts to rattle the Kremlin on the eve of Russia’s presidential election that is taking place amid a ruthless crackdown on dissent.
articles.title: Russia says Ukraine has fired more missiles at a border region on the eve of election favoring Putin

articles.author: MARK SHERMAN and LINDSAY WHITEHURST
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — With the Supreme Court's approval hovering near record lows, two justices have teamed up to promote the art of disagreeing without being nasty about it.
articles.title: Supreme Court Justices Barrett and Sotomayor, ideological opposites, unite to promote civility

articles.author: HALELUYA HADERO and MICHELLE CHAPMAN
articles.description: Former Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said Thursday that he will put together an investor group to buy TikTok after the House passed a bill that would ban the popular video app in the U.S.
articles.title: Former Treasury Secretary Steve Mnuchin says he's putting together investor group to buy TikTok

articles.author: GIOVANNA DELL'ORTO and DARREN SANDS
articles.description: MIAMI (AP) — Neglect, abandonment and destruction have been the fate of thousands of segregated cemeteries across the country where African Americans – from former slaves to prominent politicians and business owners -- were buried over many decades.
articles.title: As threats to Black cemeteries persist, a movement to preserve their sacred heritage gains strength

articles.author: NICOLE WINFIELD
articles.description: VATICAN CITY (AP) — Pope Francis says he has no plans to resign and isn’t suffering from any health problems that would require doing so, saying in a new memoir he still has “many projects to bring to fruition.”
articles.title: Pope acknowledges criticism, health issues but says in upcoming memoir he has no plans to retire

articles.author: ALI SWENSON and KELVIN CHAN
articles.description: LONDON (AP) — Artificial intelligence is supercharging the threat of election disinformation worldwide, making it easy for anyone with a smartphone and a devious imagination to create fake – but convincing – content aimed at fooling voters.
articles.title: Election disinformation takes a big leap with AI being used to deceive worldwide

articles.author: MARCIA DUNN
articles.description: SpaceX’s mega rocket blasted off on another test flight Thursday and made it farther than two previous attempts, but the spacecraft was lost as it descended back to Earth.The company said it lost contact with the spacecraft as it neared its goal, a splashdown in the Indian Ocean, about an hour after liftoff from the southern tip of Texas near the Mexican border.
articles.title: Third test flight of SpaceX's mega rocket ends with loss of spacecraft
